file_content.text: Thank you for your assistance.
The crane has been destroyed, Sergeant.
So I've heard. I've been listening in on the Republic's comm channels... they're furious at the loss. You must have done some serious damage.
Excellent.
It was nothing.
Of course.
This was a waste of my time.
I... yes, of course. As you wish.
This was a waste of my skills.
If you would prefer not to accept further contracts, that's your business.
It seems the crane was intended to build a powerful shield generator that would have made attacks on the Republic's operation impossible.
I should begin scouting for further targets. Thank you for your help--without you, our entire mission here might have been dragged to a halt.
Security around the crane is extensive. Be wary.
All of that security just for a blasted crane... it doesn't make sense....
Problems, Sergeant?
Oh! Uh... yes, my lord, I have encountered a surprising amount of resistance in my assigned task.
Ah, ahem--agent. Yes, I'm afraid I've run into an unusual amount of opposition in my current assignment.
Regrettably, yes. The enemy is presenting a far greater challenge than I'd anticipated.
I'm charged with organizing raids against the Republic's mining efforts. We strike targets of opportunity to slow their progress and drive them to retaliate.
They recently constructed a large crane that I thought would make a perfect target. I sent a team, but security was triple the expected strength--my soldiers were slaughtered.
How did you come to misjudge your enemy, Sergeant?
Why the mistake?
Perhaps determining the enemy's security first would've been the wiser move?
Didn't you check first?
My... reconnaissance was clearly not as thorough as it should've been. A mistake I will absolutely not repeat, my lord.
Sounds like you should start hiring out.
Need a professional?
That may be my only option, now.
You should've gathered more intelligence, Sergeant.
Sloppy.
I had thought my reconnaissance was thorough, but that was clearly not the case. A mistake I won't repeat.
Why would security be so heavy?
All of that for a crane?
Why should I care?
Clearly, the crane is a very important part of the Republic's operations--far more than we'd first suspected.
The crane needs to be destroyed--and the Republic punished. But I just don't have the manpower to go up against so much security.
I'll deal with this.
That's... very generous of you. Thank you.
I suppose I could help.
I feared I would never see this done. Thank you.
You'll find the crane at these coordinates. Good hunting.
Too bad. [Refuse quest]
Perhaps unit twelve could send reinforcements... no, no....
We'll crush these Republic fools yet.
